title.narrative: OUTPUT14 CHD SURVIVAL INTERVENTIONS COV.

description.narrative: Output 14 - Coverage of Child Survival Interventions: Health systems in four focus regions have the capacity to deliver high-impact child survival interventions (immunization, ICCM of malaria, pneumonia and diarrhea, LLIN) to all children under five years of age., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Health Systems Strengthening, Immunization, Polio Eradication, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 004 - Maternal, neonatal and child health: Women and children have improved and equitable access to and utilize quality, high impact maternal, neonatal and child health interventions with a special focus on the 5 most deprived regions.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 14 - Coverage of Child Survival Interventions: Health systems in four focus regions have the capacity to deliver high-impactchild survival interventions (immunization, ICCM of malaria, pneumonia and diarrhea, LLIN) to all children under five years of age.

description.narrative: Sustained gains in immunization coverage and reduction in incidence of vaccine preventable diseases, capacity of frontline workers developed on the revised EPI policy for standard quality immunization services and uptake of second year of life immunization increased through Communications for Development (C4D) initiatives | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of service providers trained on management of adolescent pregnancy and nutrition components of Adolescent Health Policy and Strategy in Volta and Northern regions
Proportion of Sub-districts in three Northern Regions who received ICCM commodities (Amoxicillin, ORS and Zinc) through UNICEF's procurement

target.value: 2016:90% of sub-districts in NR,UER,UWR received Amoxicillin, ORS and Zinc for ICCM

actual.value: 2016:UNICEF procured and supplied iCCM commodities except for antimalarial

title.narrative: Proportion of children 12-23 months fully immunized
Children < 1 year receiving measles-containing vaccine at national level

Automated dashboards (including bottleneck analysis) scorecards, alerts and reports to support monitoring and enhance use of data to improve Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn, Adolescent and Child Health services
Country switched from trivalent Oral Polio Vaccine (tOPV) to bivalent Oral Polio Vaccine (bOPV)

actual.value: 2016:Completed switch from tOPV to bOPV in April 2016

title.narrative: Polio free status sustained
